sentences.en: "The most important thing is to be honest," she says, without the trace of a blush.
sentences.cn: “最重要的是要诚实,”她毫不脸红地说.

sentences.en: A blush vermil ( l ) ioned her face.
At first blush , land is seen as a fixed or unalterable resource.
sentences.cn: 乍一看土地是一种固定的,或者说是不可改变的资源.

sentences.en: By 1982 some of the blush on Detroit's new downtown had faded.
sentences.cn: 到了1982年,底特律新商业的光彩有所减退.

sentences.en: Donald felt a blush warm his cheeks.
sentences.cn: 唐纳德感到双颊热辣辣的。

sentences.en: He silently enjoined his cheeks, Don't blush!
sentences.cn: 他默默分付两颊道: “不要烧盘!

sentences.en: Her blush told of her embarrassment.
sentences.cn: 她脸红显露出她的困窘.
她脸红表示了她的激动.

sentences.en: His remark brought a blush into the girl's cheeks.
sentences.cn: 他的话使这姑娘两颊红晕.

sentences.en: His remark brought a blush to my cheeks.
I felt myself blush. Then I sniffed back a tear.
sentences.cn: 我觉得自己的脸红了，接着我吸吸鼻子，不让眼泪掉下来。

sentences.en: I have to blush to admit that thing.
sentences.cn: 我不得不羞愧地承认了那件事.

sentences.en: It'seemed a good idea at first blush.
sentences.cn: 这个主意乍看似乎很好.

sentences.en: Joan blushed at the unexpected compliment.
sentences.cn: 这意外的夸奖让琼脸红了。

sentences.en: She blushed at herself, and seeing her reflection blush, blushed the more.
sentences.cn: 她自己羞得脸上飞起了红晕, 当她看到镜子里映出了她那羞红的脸时, 她的脸就愈加绯红了.

sentences.en: She stoped to blush and laugh at her own relapse.
sentences.cn: 她停下来,不禁脸红,笑她自己的旧病复发.

sentences.en: Wilson saw she was watching him and blushed.
sentences.cn: 威尔逊看到她在注视着自己，不由得脸红了。

words.tran_cn: 脸红的；使人脸红的；羞怯的

phrases.tran_cn: 不让某人受窘，给某人解围

trans.tran_cn: （因难堪、羞愧）面部泛起的红晕
trans.tran_en: the red colour on your face that appears when you are embarrassed
to become red in the face, usually because you are embarrassed
to become red in the face, usually because you are embarrassed
to become red in the face, usually because you are embarrassed
